title: Prediction of CPU idle-busy activity pattern.
abstract: Real-world workloads rarely saturate multi-core processor. CPU C-states can be used to reduce power consumption during processor idle time. The key unsolved problem is: when and how to use which C-state. We propose a machine learning prediction method and usage model. We evaluate this model with idle traces collected on dual-core and quad-core processor, and find this method can well predict CPUpsilas activity pattern at the error level not exceeding 4%. Compared with existing OS C-state policy, it results in 12% additional CPU power saving and 2% performance improvement. In industry, 12% power saving for any processor is very significant improvement. SPECWeb (which we used consists of 3 different benchmarks - We consistently see doubledigit power saving) is representative ldquofront-endrdquo server workload - it takes >60% DP server market segment share.
